intro: Guatteria campestris, commonly known as the campo guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and its fruits are typically small, fleshy berries. Guatteria campestris is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
